title: Chapter 115
content: # Chapter 115 A hunting ground sprawled near Winston, a favorite haunt for level 100 users. "Eh? What's that?" A user battling a wolf pointed skyward. His party members squinted at the approaching speck. One of them frowned. "It's too big to be a bird. Is it perhaps a griffon?" "There are no griffon habitats in the area." Another user gripped his sword tighter. "But I don't think there is anything else besides a griffon. It's serious if it is a griffon. Will we die?" "U-Uh? A person?" The first user's eyes widened. The dot swelled into a figure. A man in a billowing red cloak flew through the air, something golden flashing beside him in the blazing sun. "Wow... A second advancement magician." "It's my first time seeing a ranker up close. So cool!" "What is that thing shining next to him? A pet?" *Kuwaaang!* Grid tore through the sky, the forest canopy blurring beneath him. The users shrank to ants, then vanished altogether. He shot over a wide expanse of trees before his momentum faltered. *I'm out of mana.* He'd already downed one mana potion. Now his reserves ran dry again before the cooldown expired. Grid angled down, his boots crunching against the forest floor. "Winston is beyond this forest." He checked his remaining mana. "I can recover some while walking." The woods pressed close around him, dense and quiet. Grid gauged the distance to Winston, then examined the frostlight orc chief's helmet sitting in his inventory. After this forest, he would encounter crowds. The helmet was the mark of the Human Slaughterer. People would recognize it. *I have to quickly replace this helmet.* Grid vowed once more to commission something worthy of a mythical hero. Above his head, the pavranium circled in lazy loops. It seemed almost... pleased. "Are you excited to get fresh air after being trapped in a box for 300 years?" Grid asked. The pavranium offered no reply. Of course it didn't. It had a will, but it was just a mineral. It couldn't carry out a conversation. Grid kept talking anyway. "But aren't you unbelievably fast? My flight speed was 100 meters in 7 seconds, yet you managed to keep up. Do you have tireless stamina as well?" The mineral gleamed. Grid watched it with the affection a blacksmith reserves for the finest materials. "Kuwooh!" Grid's head snapped up. "Give it to me! Human! Your life! Flesh and bone! Separate!" Sturdy orcs crashed through the underbrush, crude red leather strapped to their bodies. Large wolves loped beside them. Their command of the human language marked them as wolf fang orcs, a powerful breed known for their intelligence and brutality. *Grrrung.* One wolf lifted its muzzle, nostrils flaring. The beast reacted to the bloody reek of Malacus' Cloak. It caught the scent and led its pack straight here. *Kuuong! Kung!* "Kyaooooh!" Ogres. Goblins. Snakes. Every manner of monster poured through the trees. In seconds, Grid stood surrounded by a hundred enemies. "Wow... What is this?" Users hunting nearby heard the commotion and came running. They gawked at the scene, at all types of monsters converging on a single player. "That person is screwed." "What did he do wrong that angered so many mobs?" One user shook his head. "Tsk tsk. Purposely angering mobs like this. He should hunt in moderation." The spectators murmured among themselves, oblivious to the truth. *Syuok! Syuok!* Goblin archers in the rear nocked arrows. The users saw the dark rain covering the sky and assumed Grid would die. But Grid's stats pushed him toward level 200 combat effectiveness. He'd observed Jishuka's expert archery. The goblins' clumsy volleys looked like children's pranks. "Are there any idiots who would be killed by these arrows?" Grid drew the Ideal Dagger. He triggered Wind Blast. *Kuwaaaang!* Grid had dumped every point from reaching level 114 into strength. Wind Blast's damage scaled with attack power. The skill carved through the arrow storm and kept going. "Kiek!" "Kyak!" The volley disintegrated. Goblin archers screamed as Wind Blast severed arms and legs. Bodies crumpled. The remaining monsters roared and charged as one. "Wearing the cloak was worthwhile!" Grid grinned. Hunting meant levels. Grid swapped to Dainsleif and drank a mana potion. He activated Wave, sweeping it in broad arcs. Monsters approaching from all sides collapsed in waves. Ogres survived the initial blast but stumbled under the debuff, their movements sluggish. They couldn't threaten Grid with that crawling pace. *Peeok! Pajik!* "Keok!" *Puoook!* "Kkieek!" Wave killed most monsters outright. Grid finished the stragglers one by one. The few surviving goblins loosed desperate arrows. A handful flew true, straight at Grid's exposed back. "Che!" Grid spun too late. He braced for impact. The arrows never landed. *Kwajak! Kwajajajak!* Pavranium blurred around Grid's body, shattering every shaft mid-flight. "Wow..." The watching users stared. This swordsman wielded overwhelming attack power with his black greatsword while a metal pet defended him. Perfect balance. One user stepped forward. "That's amazing... Excuse me, but what is your class?" Grid swept up the last monsters with pavranium's help and started looting. The users crowded closer, questions spilling out. "What is that gold object floating next to you? Is that a pet? Or maybe a new style of armor?" "Mister, how about you? Aren't you actually a high level user? Why is a high level user hunting in a place like this? Is there anything good here?" "Mister?" "Mister, are you deaf? Answer us." Grid had watched these users stand idle while monsters swarmed him. Not one offered help. He'd never been friendly toward people anyway. He had no obligation to answer their questions. "This is too annoying." Grid looked up. "Fly." He shot into the sky, leaving the users gaping below. "...?" They blinked. After a few minutes, posts began appearing in communities around the world. --- **** *It was a place called Popo Forest near Winston. I hunted with my friend there and saw a high level user slaughtering mobs. Then after wiping out all the mobs, he flew away. A swordsman was flying?* **RnfkRk's comment:** ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ A swordsman can't fly ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ **Durururubam's reply:** A swordsman was flying? I'm a priest but I can't use Heal. ㅂㅅ **Black Dragon's Right Arm's comment:** Kukuk... That swordsman was me... Kukukuk... I was careful but I never thought someone would witness it... Yare yare... **Zkxhfm's comment:** Liar's disease. **Admiral's comment:** Did your mother eat seaweed soup on the day you were born? **30,000 won Salary's comment:** Don't write shit just to gain traffic. --- The abuse was immediate and brutal. Other witnesses saw what happened to the original poster and kept quiet. The topic died before it could spread. Meanwhile, Grid landed at Khan's smithy and went straight to the furnace. He placed the pavranium inside and carefully adjusted the temperature, searching for the melting point. "It is 1,900 degrees." The pavranium was so small it smelted almost instantly. *I don't want to carry it around in an egg shape until I make the Vessel of the Soul, so I should transform it into something else.* The volume was minuscule. Not enough to produce a proper weapon. The pavranium wouldn't make even a dagger. To create an item, Grid would need to mix in other materials. But contaminating pure pavranium felt wrong. "Let's be satisfied with changing the shape." After spending time with the mineral, he'd noticed its tendency to orbit the owner for protection. He needed to exploit that feature. *A shape more suitable for defense than an egg... Ah!* Malacus' shield flickered through his memory. "He formed a disc-shaped shield with magic power at each attacked point, effectively blocking the attack..." *Ttang! Ttang!* Grid hammered with care. The pavranium slowly flattened under his strikes. After a while, two discs emerged, each slightly smaller than an adult's palm. "Okay." Grid lifted the discs. They floated free, then began circling his body in smooth orbits. Relief washed through him. This should protect him from most attacks. Footsteps echoed in the doorway. Jishuka entered the smithy. Grid turned to her. "Shoot an arrow at me." "Huh?" "Hurry." Jishuka studied the golden discs spinning around Grid. Understanding dawned on her face. "Hrmm, okay." She nocked an arrow and fired without hesitation. *Syuk!* *Chaaeng!* The two discs blurred. They intercepted the arrow mid-flight, deflecting it completely. "That is great..." Jishuka's words didn't match her sour expression. *It's that simple to block? Did I shoot it too weakly?* "Hey, wait a minute!" Grid raised his hands. Jishuka fired again. This time she pulled the bowstring back to its absolute limit. *Swaeek!* "Aaaagh!" The arrow screamed toward Grid's chest. *Jjejeong!* "...Hah!" Grid and Jishuka exhaled simultaneously. Jishuka's came out as a displeased sneer. Grid's was pure delight. "This arrow can even pierce through steel..." Grid examined the discs. "Isn't this extremely durable? Like Braham said, it's the peak of all minerals." The golden discs had stopped Jishuka's arrow cold. But the impact was severe. The disc that took the hit froze in place, unable to move for two full seconds before resuming its orbit. *If it receives excessive shock, it is immobilized for two seconds.* If Jishuka kept firing at full strength, two discs wouldn't protect his entire body. Grid felt the urgency of completing this quest and claiming the rest of the pavranium. *But... If there are 27 more pavranium of this size, it won't be enough to make armor... Well, it isn't a problem. I can still use it.* Grid's mind was flexible. Rather than force a complete armor set from limited materials, he should maximize efficiency through multiple small items. *For example, attaching a blade made of pavranium to armor. The blade would move on its own to protect me from attacks I can't react to, or if the enemy attacks me from an unexpected angle.* An item that could move on its own. If he cleared this quest and gained the remaining pavranium, he would write a new chapter in the history of equipment. As Grid savored the thought, someone knocked on the smithy door. Jishuka glanced at the discs. "These discs, they don't need to be exposed to other people right?" "Of course." Grid nodded. "Isn't it common sense to hide it?" "Yes." Grid placed the discs in his inventory. The smithy doors swung open. One knight and dozens of soldiers entered. They saluted Grid with crisp precision. "Earl Steim is looking for you." "Earl Steim?" Grid straightened. "Lady Irene's father?" "Yes." "Oh? Okay! Let's go!" *Why would the master of the north, one of the great powers in the Eternal Kingdom, summon me?* Grid followed the knight toward the door. *And why is a high-level NPC knight, famous for their arrogance, acting so respectful toward a user?* Jishuka watched the knight and soldiers escort Grid from the smithy. She frowned. "What is this?" Vantner's armor production would have to wait. --- **Glossary of Common Korean Terms.** **OG:** Glossary Link. **Current schedule:** 20 chapters a week.
